details.title: Polling across the 72 constituencies will begin at 8 am
details.content:
Chhattisgarh: Visuals from a polling station in Bilaspur district's Pendra. Voting for the second phase of #ChhattisgarhElections2018 will be conducted today. 72 constituencies will undergo voting at 8 am today. pic.twitter.com/6aiydKuluz

— ANI (@ANI) November 20, 2018

As many as 130 candidates, contesting in the second phase of the elections are facing criminal charges. 90 of them involve serious charges like attempt to murder. Among the 90 candidates facing serious criminal charges, 11 are from the Congress, 13 from the AAP and 14 from the Janta Congress Chhattisgarh (J). 

A total of 239 multi-millionaire candidates are also contesting the polls. Among the multimillionaires, 53 are from the Congress, 61 from the BJP and 35 from Janta Congress Chhattisgarh (J).

details.title: 130 candidates with criminal charges, 239 multi-millionaires in fray today
details.content:
As many as 130 candidates, contesting in the second phase of the elections are facing criminal charges. 90 of them involve serious charges like attempt to murder. Among the 90 candidates facing serious criminal charges, 11 are from the Congress, 13 from the AAP and 14 from the Janta Congress Chhattisgarh (J).

A total of 239 multi-millionaire candidates are also contesting the polls. Among the multimillionaires, 53 are from the Congress, 61 from the BJP and 35 from Janta Congress Chhattisgarh (J).

details.title: Voting underway at a booth in Ambikapur
details.content: (Photo|ANI)

details.title: Former CM Ajit Jogi's family in fray
details.content: The entire Jogi family, except his son are contesting the second phase of Assembly polls with an aim to defeat the ruling BJP and Congress. Ajit Jogi is contesting from Marwahi, his wife Renu Jogi is contesting from Konta, his daugther-in-law Richa Jogi is contesting from Akaltara.

details.title: Six Naxal-affected areas go to polls today
details.content: Six Naxals-infested districts, Gariaband, Dhamtari, Mahasamund, Kabirdham, Jashpur, and Balrampur are going to polls today.

details.title: Voting begins in Raipur amid tight security
details.content: (Photo|EPS)

details.title: PM Narendra Modi urges people of Chhattisgarh to participate in large numbers in 'the festival of democracy'
details.content:
छत्तीसगढ़ में आज दूसरे और अंतिम चरण का मतदान है। सभी मतदाताओं से मेरा निवेदन है कि वे पूरे उत्साह के साथ भारी संख्या में मतदान कर लोकतंत्र के महापर्व को सफल बनाएं।

— Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) November 20, 2018

details.title: EVM glitches reported in some booths in Raipur
details.content: EVM glitches have been reported from Jora booth in Raipur and EVM's in two booths in the Raipur (north) seat have also stopped functioning.

details.title: Former CM and Janata Congress chief Ajit Jogi and his son Amit cast their votes at a polling booth in Pendra
EVM snag in over two-dozen booths in Raipur, upset voters returning
details.content:
The voters were seen irritated owing to delay in getting the problem resolved. In some polling booths, the voters were seen returning without exercising their franchise. The spokesperson of the chief electoral office in Raipur, however, claimed that the technical issues reported in some of the booths in the morning have been promptly attended and smooth conduct of polls remains underway everywhere.

(CLICK HERE TO READ MORE)

details.title: 12.54 % voting recorded
details.content: 12.54% voting recorded till 10 AM across 72 constituencies in the second phase of voting.

details.title: Congress leaders meet Election Commission over EVM tampering
details.content:
A delegation of Congress leaders led by PL Punia meet the Election Commission in Delhi over alleging attempts to misuse and tamper EVMs in #Chhattisgarh. pic.twitter.com/6HFnHbS0SA

— ANI (@ANI) November 20, 2018

details.title: WATCH| Polling underway in Raipur amidst technical snag
Congress Party led by Chhattisgarh Incharge PL Punia coming-out after meet with Election Commission
details.content: Congress Party led by Chhattisgarh Incharge PL Punia coming-out after meet with Election Commission of India at Nirvachan Sadan. PL Punia complained to the Election Commission that three EVMs were found at the residence of the Headmaster of Chirmiri municipality. (Photo| Praveen Negi/ EPS)

details.title: 110-year-old woman exercises her electoral franchise
details.content: 110-year-old Magalin Bai Nishad, from Gariyaband District cast her vote in the second phase of Assembly election. (Photo| CEO Chhattisgarh)

details.title: 23.75 % turnout till 12.30 pm
details.content: 23.75 per cent turnout was recorded across 72 constituencies till 12.30 pm.

details.title: CM Raman Singh, wife cast  their vote in hometown
details.content: CM Raman Singh along with his wife exercised their electoral franchise at his home town in Kawardha.

details.title: CM Raman Singh, wife cast vote in their hometown
details.content: CM Raman Singh along with his wife exercised their electoral franchise at his home town in Kawardha.(Photo|ANI)

details.title: Congress submits memorandum to the EC on alleged EVM tampering
details.content: Congress submits memorandum to the Election Commission of India bringing attention to 'urgent incidents' of EVM tampering that "have significant bearing on the outcome of Chhattisgarh Assembly Elections".

details.title: Woman Naxal gunned down in encounter in Sukma
details.content: A woman Naxal was Tuesday gunned down in an encounter with security forces in Chhattisgarh's Sukma district, police said. The woman ultra, identified as Hemla Ayathi, was a member of Badesetti local organisation squad (LOS) of Maoist
